noun.description: A gun, especially one fired from shoulder level, having a long spirally grooved barrel intended to make a bullet spin and thereby have greater accuracy over a long distance.

verb.description: Make spiral grooves in (a gun or its barrel or bore) to make a bullet spin and thereby have greater accuracy over a long distance.
examples: a line of replacement rifled barrels

verb.description: Hit, throw, or kick (a ball or puck) hard and straight.
examples: he rifled a hard, rising shot from just inside the blue line

origin: Middle English: from Old French rifler graze, plunder, of Germanic origin.
